reporter_caption.center: PROGRESSIVE CAS. INS. v. HOLLOWAY, 1D05-4395 (Fla.App. 1 Dist. 12-12-2005)

caption.center: PROGRESSIVE CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. JAMES M. HOLLOWAY,

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, First District.

opinion.opinion_text: [EDITORS' NOTE: THIS OPINION WAS WITHDRAWN ON JANUARY 20, 2006.]
opinion.posture: An appeal from the Circuit Court for Escambia County, Nickolas P. Geeker, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Mark J. Upton, Daphne, Alabama, for Appellant.
Joseph L. Hammons, Pensacola, for Appellee.
opinion.opinion_text:
Upon consideration of the appellant's response to the Court's order of October 27, 2005, the Court has determined that the order denying the appellant's "Renewed Motion for Directed Verdict, Motion for Judgment Notwithstanding the Verdict, or in the Alternative, for a New Trial," is not an appealable order. Fla.R.App.P. 9.130(a)(4); 9.020(h). Accordingly, the appeal is hereby dismissed for lack of jurisdiction.
ERVIN, DAVIS and BENTON, JJ., CONCUR.
NOT FINAL UNTIL TIME EXPIRES TO FILE MOTION FOR REHEARING AND DISPOSITION THEREOF IF FILED
